triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on safe learning methods for real-world robotic deployments and control.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper reviews machine learning approaches to achieve safe decision-making under uncertainties in robotics.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: A core focus of the paper covering reinforcement learning approaches that encourage safety and robustness.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper unifies language and frameworks from control theory with reinforcement learning research for safe robot control.

triples.name: Optimal control
triples.relevance: Optimal control methods are discussed as approaches to achieve safe decision-making and improve robot control performance.

triples.name: Model predictive control
triples.relevance: Model predictive control is a learning-based control approach for safely improving robotic system performance.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Adaptive control is discussed as a method to safely improve performance by learning uncertain system dynamics.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper reviews methods that can formally certify the safety of learned control policies for robots.

triples.name: Uncertainty quantification
triples.relevance: The paper addresses safe decision-making under uncertainties, a key application of uncertainty quantification in robotics.

triples.name: Human-robot interaction
triples.relevance: The paper emphasizes safe robot learning for scenarios where robots operate in close proximity to humans.
